title: Why are Ranged Champions able to build Gauntlet?
body:
Just... Why?
I understand the usefulness of Iceborn Gauntlet as it helps Mellee Champions that lack chain CC to get some sticking power

But, I mean, why would an ADC be able to do so? They're already ranged, most of them (mainly the ones who build Gauntlet now)  have effective dashes and mobility tools and still they are able to build an item which gives them high damage output, some tankiness, high CDR and almost a permanent slow. Even building Frozen Mallet on ranged Champions reduces the slow effectiveness... (that would be an option also, instead of not letting ranged Champions purchase it)

I'm not talking only about Ezreal. I've seen it used by Vayne and Lucian... It's really annoying to deal with it and offers no counterplay besides bursting the enemy instantly.

replies.body: I love going Iceborn and PD on Vayne. TRY TO CATCH ME.
Honestly I'd even be fine with that, if "try to catch me" didn't also mean "try to escape from me".

I think you found the nail and hit it on the head here. The problem with Iceborn is that it doesn't really have a niche at all right now. It's good for chasing, it's good for kiting, it's good for damage, it's good for cooldown reduction.

Out of curiousity, why wouldn't you just build Frozen Mallet on Vayne?  

She doesn't really benefit from the armor or CDR the same way as other carries, she doesn't doesn't greatly benefit from Spellblade due to low base AD and reliance on Q for positioning, and the raw health would be more useful for mitigating burst damage (since it helps against all types of damage).

I beg to differ. wouldn't the cdr be great? while she has low base AD, she gets to tumble more due to cdr. every time she tumbles she gets an empowered auto, not just from spellblade, but from the %total AD damage on q. The mana is kindve eh since no vayne should ever run out, but the armor could be situationally useful depending on the comp. for instance if they have a zed or something.

I think the gauntlet would ultimately make her q hit a bit harder, giver her extra utility from the slow, extra utility from being able to tumble more often, and more damage/utility  from having her ult up more often(though I admit that particular cd is usually not a problem.)

I would assume it has to deal with the Sheen proc. The low cooldown of her Q means she can theoretically get a ton of sheen procs in a short amount of time, and the cooldown on Spellblade (1.5 seconds) syncs up perfectly with her Q cooldown (2 seconds at rank 5, 1.6 after 20% CDR), so in theory she would compensate for low base AD with the ability to repeatedly proc the slow.

Additionally, Vayne would probably appreciate the CDR on her E and R.

Keep in mind that I might be wrong about all the stuff I said since I don't play Vayne.

It's not an advantage. The majority of the marksman class has been reworked to become dependent on critical strike chance, so building an item that gives you no AD, no AS, no LS and no crit is very inefficient. If the player is building some kite power and tankiness and exchanging an entire item slot for it, that's a fair trade. 

Ezreal is definitely an outlier. Riot attempted to rework him into a full AD caster but even though they tried to make ER good on him they did nothing to increase his crit dependence. The bolt from Ezreal's Arcane Shift should be changed to deal physical damage and be able to critically strike, and his ultimate should have its base damage lowered and be able to critically strike champions. The issue is that Riot left AD Ezreal so bad for so long that he has a dedicated AP mid player base now, and if they change him to be more crit dependent they are killing that build.

Vayne and Lucian should see significant power drops by building IBG, especially since 20% crit is redundant on someone who rushes ER.

Honestly this is primarily an issue, (I don't think IBG/trinity on Ez is a bad thing) of what his kit can do that others can't. Look at Ezreal traditionally, after his nerfs from release, he was primarily a 'low tier ADC pick' due to his usually non-ADC build, which could be a good ADC pick based off team comp / enemy team comp due to him being a safe ADC that needs next to no peel while offering poke

Add in IBG, trinity was still more powerful for the single target damage and synergized better than IBG for infinity edge, when ahead or fed Ezreal could deal a ton of damage, he also now has BOTRK available to him.

Now we're in S6, mages took a hit, assassin mids and tank tops that have a ton of dive reign supreme, Ezreal is a really popular pick due to his utility primarily from IBG, he helps chase down, he helps poke, he helps prevent being engaged onto. He still isn't the highest damage ADC, but he's a fairly safe pick even if he gives up lane pressure due to being Ez and/or building tear, and he usually does well despite team or enemy picks due to the nature of his kit with the items.

It's essentially the 'what does his kit offer with items' compared to other champions problem- and the answer is that really no other ADC offers the same range and threat with IBG that Ezreal does.

I don't think Ezreal is a problem, I think it's a problem of the meta we're in which is why he's so prolific, he's essentially the only ADC building IBG, and I think the flexibility of having an Ezreal as an ADC with IBG is good for diversity and anyone who enjoys the play style. Maybe they can nerf the width of the proc on ranged again, but IBG on Ez is fine imo

And don't forget, living longer also means getting to pump out more damage, even though it's over a longer period of time, which can be considered a pseudo damage increase in a way.

I agree with you that it offers lots of useful stats, but the real problem with Iceborn appears when it is spammed from long range without too much of a risk. Iceborn helps the user to increase its safety to the point where the user can just "kite" the whole game.

Also, if the respective ADC builds Iceborn, his/her damage potential will be extremely lowered, especially if it is built very early. Their DPS will be low in general, and they can be literally ignored.

Now... I know what, or better said, who... is the real problem...{{champion:81}}.
